intro: Myoporum latisepalum, commonly known as the broad-sepal myoporum, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Myoporum latisepalum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and floral display. It thrives in well-drained soils and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
